content.rendered:
This Week in Genesis is coming to you from deep in the heart of Texas. It’s a holiday weekend here in North America – today sees Canada celebrating Canada Day, and on Monday, the US celebrates Independence Day. Let the good times roll!

Here’s what new in our community this week.

Showcase

This week, a number of the “Ladies of Genesis” launched new sites.

… Katie Rosebraugh launched a rebrand of  her own site using Restored 316’s “Market” Theme.

Restyled my brand: https://t.co/nrVRGthI7y pic.twitter.com/oLT2AlZGo8

— Katie Rosebraugh (@mskatiegail) June 28, 2016

…Christina Arasmo created a custom Genesis Child theme for The Comfort Authority.

… Tara Claeys for Communikids

New website for CommuniKids! https://t.co/4IcJr5XOkb #genesiswp @BeaverBuilder pic.twitter.com/F2ahqvR1a0

— Tara Claeys (@design_tlc) June 29, 2016

and Jenny Power for Civium Strats, another custom Genesis theme.

Podcasts

This week on @officehoursfm, the discussion was on turning your expertise into recurring revenue

Podcast day! Join me at 2pET for a live interview with @el_steele. https://t.co/f2pQnkSoTJ pic.twitter.com/KPo8FZggyc

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) June 30, 2016

Tonya teased us with what’s coming up in her Know the Code lab series in July:

Hey #GenesisWP dev, I started working on the Developer's Child Theme lab coming in July. All the goodies for you. https://t.co/Fk96pplTky

— Know The Code (@KnowTheCodePro) June 27, 2016

Tutorials

The Genesis Community is great about sharing. Here are some of the tutorials which were published this week:

Ginger wrote a tutorial on moving the primary navigation to Header Right in Utility Pro. I’ve book marked this tutorial, because I’ve been wanting to do this myself!

Move that Primary Nav menu to Header Right in Utility Pro https://t.co/rD0VvUTfdH #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/ZEF0vLxL9G

— Ginger Coolidge (@gscoolidge) June 29, 2016

Ren Ventura blogged about Customizing the Genesis Author Box – thanks for sharing, Marcy!

Customizing the Genesis Author Box | EngageWP https://t.co/FDxXUpPzc8 #GenesisWP

— Marcy Diaz (@mjsdiaz1) June 30, 2016

Sridhar shared a tutorial on updating the Genesis Sample theme to replace the background header image with an inline logo:

Fixed Shrinking Header with inline logo and menu in Genesis:https://t.co/780LMOf87h

Demo: https://t.co/wvWIjkFqMh

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) June 27, 2016

Speaking of Sridhar, he finally got to move into his new house this week – I know it’s been a long time coming, so congratulations on that, Sridhar!

Best of the rest

This past weekend, WordCamp Europe took place in Vienna, Austria. We saw a number of tweets from the Genesis community. It looks like they had a fun get-together!

#genesiswp meetup at #wceu pic.twitter.com/GIy0AJzXMC

— Gary Jones (@GaryJ) June 25, 2016

Not quite Abbey Road #genesiswp meet up at #wceu pic.twitter.com/3S5qE44LcI

— Jo Waltham (@JoWaltham) June 25, 2016

Cathy shared how to Write Less And Increase Views this Summer

Write Less And Increase Views this Summer #genesiswp #emailmarketing hat tip: @rosemarywatson https://t.co/aHl5XyS3nF

— WordPress Barista (@WPBarista) June 30, 2016

PS If you’re planning on being in the DFW area at the end of July, the talented Lindsey Riel has been announced as a guest speak at the upcoming Declare Conference. She will be talking about “5 Lies We Believe about Running a website”. I’m looking forward to this!

At #declareconf @lindseyriel of Pretty Darn Cute Design will share "5 Lies We Believe About Running a Website". pic.twitter.com/q0URjdTYUn

— Declare Conference (@DeclareConf) June 29, 2016

Thanks for joining me this week. If you’re in Canada or the US – have a happy holiday weekend! Stay safe! For our other readers – enjoy your weekend, and I’m looking forward to seeing what you’re doing with Genesis next week! Thank you to Nick for having me as a guest editor this week!

I would also be remiss if I didn’t give a shoutout to those in the community who volunteer their time on the StudioPress community forum. If you’ve got time this weekend, hit up some of the oustanding questions over there: StudioPress community forums

The weekend is a perfect time to update your #GenesisWP site, learn some new code, or help others in the community: https://t.co/A3FNGBDSI9

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) July 1, 2016

excerpt.rendered: Beautiful new Genesis sites, WordCamp Europe photos, and turning your expertise into recurring revenue.
